item.title: Fisherwomen ride the rough waves while India’s blue economy blooms
item.author: pkowshik@gmail.com (Priyamvada Kowshik)
item.description: India’s fisherwomen face not only economic instability but also the shrinking availability of open spaces to carry out value-added fishing activities Women’s employment is given limited priority in India’s draft blue economy policy framework.

item.title: Agriculture has a plastic problem and it’s threatening the future of food
item.author: pkowshik@gmail.com (Priyamvada Kowshik)
item.description: The application of synthetic polymer-based technologies in agriculture, has found wide ranging uses, making it an integral part of food production today.Single-use or short-lived, they are found to be a major source of micro and nanoplastics in the soil, which can have a long term impact on our health and environment.
